issue.subject: Enhance roles definition when editing a resource
issue.description:
When adding or editing a resource, the user is asked to fill a form with several attributes.
I suggest to make some changes in this form to simplify it / be more comprehensible.

See attachment with proposals in read.

journals.notes:
Hello Thomas,

Do you have any remark on our proposal ?

Thanks
Yes I agree with all your notes. I'd add one. It would be great to add a button to fill all potential authorized users.
The button "add all potential users" is a nice feature indeed. Do you see it at the general level or for each role ?

Dear All,

* I prefer keeping optional attribute like "Description" as it used as a common property in every easySDI object types; but such property should be presented as a textarea instead of a simple text entry.
* State property has been presented in a simple select list as such state can be more than two values (i.e. trash); for now only two values are implemented and it could be a cosmetic add-on...
* Organism selected value could be effectively filled in when only one organism is available, you're right
* Roles accordions are not convenient at all, you're right, and could be removed completely (as I understand in your proposal why keeping one accordion as there won't be lot of users for each role ?). For now all roles are automatically filled in when organism property is defined for the first time and adding potential users seems to be a nice option. But we must care about large organism which describes lots of editors (i.e. Bern) and didn't want to remove manually users added with such option... In this case I will add a new button "Empty roles".

* Additionally we have seen that all resource's managers can be removed so we have potentially ghost resources that no one can manage anymore :-(
For such case, easySDI must force that at least one resource's manager is defined!

Best Wishes,
Bruno

I prefer keeping optional attribute like "Description" as it used as a common property in every easySDI object types;

for now only two values are implemented and it could be a cosmetic add-on...

Thanks :-) 
Roles accordions are not convenient at all, you're right, and could be removed completely (as I understand in your
 proposal why keeping one accordion as there won't be lot of users for each role ?).
I would keep one accordion because, by default, roles are nots shown : it was the idea of accordion --> "hidding" advanced options since roles are defined automatically via organism. By doing like this, this form remain simple (for a small organisation) BUT offers as well all need advanced options (for big organisation).

(i.e. Bern) and didn't want to remove manually users added with such option... In this case I will add a new button
"Empty roles".
So we would have two buttons "add all users" (means all users who have potential roles) and "remove all users". Seems good and covers all use cases. 
Additionally we have seen that all resource's managers can be removed so we have potentially ghost resources that no
one can manage anymore :-( For such case, easySDI must force that at least one resource's manager is defined!
Yes, easySDI must check that at least one user is defined for each role before saving the form.

Ok for removing "description" for all easysdi object. 

We also have to display the only roles associated to the resource type (ex: no difusion for contacts). We can also considere to display only roles associated to at least one user.

I think only ressource manager should be mandatory. The ressource manager can think that a resource won't never be difused

We also have to display the only roles associated to the resource type (ex: no difusion for contacts).
It's already on its way : #694 #693 
We can also considere to display only roles associated to at least one user.
I do not see the need really... it could even be confusing (conditionnal display). Can you explain this need Thomas ? 
I think only ressource manager should be mandatory. The ressource manager can think that
a resource won't never be difused
Good point !

I agree that resource's manager should be the only mandatory role!
But to prevent any dysfunction, such mandatory fields implies additional control (information message and choice of actions if an easySDI user tries to be removed and is the only one manager of at least one resource, same case if an Administrator wants to remove the potential role of resource's manager to an easySDI user which is the only one manager of at least one resource)
For such case, contact plug-in and some back office interfaces must be completed to full-fill such use cases...

Regarding such mandatory role, I guess that it will be more logical that creator of a new resource will be automatically attached to the resource's manager role and not to each roles as they will be optional.

About roles definition we could also put them inside a new tab called "Roles" like in back-office roles' contact definition instead of using any accordion! (see attachment:role_tab.png)

Let's try to summarize this issue ! :-)


What has to be done :

- keep the description but change the type (to textarea). If we want to hide it, we will use CSS.
- change state property to a toggle.
- Organism selected value should be filled by default when only one organism is available
- add two buttons : "add all users" / "remove all users" (users of the selected organism)
- check that at least one "resource manager" is defined (mandatory field)
- add additional control (see last note https://forge.easysdi.org/issues/699#note-9 )


what still has to be discussed :

- change the terminology "status" to "Active" yes/no (to avoid the confusion with the status of the metadata.
- about role, definition, I agree we can remove the accordion and use the same layout as in backend BUT keep it in the same tab (not a new one). Why ? because there are interaction between the choise of organism and the users so it should be in the same tab.


I hope I did not forget anything...
